Package it.polimi.ingsw.server

Class Server

java.lang.Object
it.polimi.ingsw.server.Server
Direct Known Subclasses:
TurnControllerTest.ServerStub
public class Server
extends java.lang.Object
Server class is the main one of the server side, it allows clients to connect, play together and also starts the match.

  • Field Summary

    private java.util.Map<VirtualClient,​SocketClientConnection> clientToConnection

      private final SocketServer socketServer

    • idMapClient

      private final java.util.Map<java.lang.Integer,​VirtualClient> idMapClient
      This hashmap permits identifying a Virtual Client relying on his client ID, which was set at the join. The client has to be connected to the server.

    • nameMapId

      private final java.util.Map<java.lang.String,​java.lang.Integer> nameMapId
      This hashmap permits finding client ID relying on his unique nickname. The client has to be connected to the server.

    • idMapName

      private final java.util.Map<java.lang.Integer,​java.lang.String> idMapName
      This hashmap permits finding client nickname relying on his unique ID. The client has to be connected to the server.

      private final java.util.Map<VirtualClient,​SocketClientConnection> clientToConnection
      This hashmap permits identifying a Virtual Client relying on his active connection with the server. The client has to be connected to the server.

  • Constructor Details

    • Server

      public Server()
      Constructor Server creates the instance of the server, based on a socket and the mapping between VirtualClient, nicknames and client ids. It also creates a new game session.

  • Method Details

    • quitter

      public void quitter()
      Method quitter permits quitting from the server application, closing all active connections.

    • getSocketServer

      public SocketServer getSocketServer()
      Method getSocketServer returns the socketServer of this Server object.
      Returns:
      the socketServer (type SocketServer) of this Server object.

    • getGameByID

      public GameHandler getGameByID​(int id)
      Method getGameByID returns the game handler by having the client ID. It's useful for getting the game handler from the socket handler.
      Parameters:
      id - of type int - the client ID.
      Returns:
      GameHandler - the associated game handler.

    • setTotalPlayers

      protected void setTotalPlayers​(int totalPlayers) throws OutOfBoundException
      Method setTotalPlayers sets the maximum number of player relying on the input provided by the first user who connects. He's is also called the "lobby host".
      Parameters:
      totalPlayers - of type int - the number of players provided by the first user connected.
      Throws:
      OutOfBoundException - when the input is not in the correct player range.
      See Also:
      for the max/min player parameters.

    • getClientByID

      public VirtualClient getClientByID​(int id)
      Method getClientByID returns a link to the desired virtual client, in order to make operations on it (like send, etc).
      Parameters:
      id - of type int - the id of the virtual client needed.
      Returns:
      VirtualClient - the correct virtual client.

    • getNicknameByID

      public java.lang.String getNicknameByID​(int id)
      Method getNicknameByID returns the user nickname from the hashmap explained above.
      Parameters:
      id - of type int - the id of the client.
      Returns:
      String - the nickname of the associated player.

    • getIDByNickname

      public int getIDByNickname​(java.lang.String nickname)
      Method getIDByNickname returns the user ID from the nickname's hashmap explained above.
      Parameters:
      nickname - of type String - the user's nickname.
      Returns:
      int - his clientID inside the model class.

    • lobby

      public void lobby​(SocketClientConnection c) throws java.lang.InterruptedException
      Method lobby creates or handle a lobby, which is a common room used before a match. In this room, connected players are waiting for other ones, in order to reach the correct players' number for playing. If the waiting clients' queue is empty, the server creates a new lobby and ask the first player to choose the capacity. After that, when a client connects, it checks if the players number has been reached; if true, starts the match.
      Parameters:
      c - of type SocketClientConnection - a single client connection, which is used for common operations(like sending/receiving commands, etc).
      Throws:
      java.lang.InterruptedException - when TimeUnit throws it.

    • unregisterClient

      public void unregisterClient​(int clientID)
      Method unregisterClient deletes a client from the hashmaps and active lists, unregistering his connection with the server.
      Parameters:
      clientID - of type int - the ID of the virtual client to be removed.

    • registerConnection

      public java.lang.Integer registerConnection​(java.lang.String nickname, SocketClientConnection socketClientHandler)
      Method registerConnection registers a new connection between the client and the server, by inserting him in the registry hashmaps. If the nickname has already been chosen, it simply ignores this step and notify the client about this fact, asking him to provide a new nickname.
      Parameters:
      nickname - of type String - the nickname chosen by the client.
      socketClientHandler - of type SocketClientConnection - the active connection between server socket and client socket.
      Returns:
      Integer - the client ID if everything goes fine, null otherwise.

    • createClientID

      public int createClientID()
      Method createClientID returns a new client ID for a fresh-connected client. It's based on an attribute which considers the number of people connected to this server since his startup.
      Returns:
      int - the generated client id.

    • main

      public static void main​(java.lang.String[] args)
      The main class of the server. It simply creates a new server class, adding a server socket to an executor.
      Parameters:
      args - of type String[] - the main args, like any Java application.
